p: It is important to recognize that treating the host response is an approach that might be used in patients with other forms of acute critical illness. It appeared to work in patients with Ebola 18 and it would probably work in any illness that involves endothelial dysfunction and the loss of vascular barrier integrity, for example, other emerging virus diseases, sepsis, community-acquired pneumonia and even sporadic illnesses like Hantavirus infection 18. It could also be considered for treating patients with Nipah virus infection, a recent problem in India 28. This disease is characterized by endothelial dysfunction 29, and statins and ARBs have beneficial effects on endothelial cells, including those in the brain 30 31.
